data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission
data.sentence: The word ءَامَنُوا comes from the root ا م ن and is associated with the meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: bring, convey, benefit, bestowed upon; alter or change a thing for the worse, corrupted, tainted, infected, render it ill-smelling; adjusting, repairing; difference between two persons; become jealous; procure; other than (exclusively), except, without; lies; [a man’s] dislike of another’s participation in what supposedly his right; care of what is sacred or inviolable to avoid suspicion of disdain; cognizance or badge of a free non-Muslim subjects in a Muslim government; one who puts off the furniture of his camel from off him to relieve and ease him. mughiraat - raiders.
data.sentence: The word بِغَيْرِ comes from the root غ ي ر and is associated with the meanings: bring, convey, benefit, bestowed upon; alter or change a thing for the worse, corrupted, tainted, infected, render it ill-smelling; adjusting, repairing; difference between two persons; become jealous; procure; other than (exclusively), except, without; lies; [a man’s] dislike of another’s participation in what supposedly his right; care of what is sacred or inviolable to avoid suspicion of disdain; cognizance or badge of a free non-Muslim subjects in a Muslim government; one who puts off the furniture of his camel from off him to relieve and ease him. mughiraat - raiders.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قُلْ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.
data.sentence: The word الدُّنْيَا comes from the root د ن و and is associated with the meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.

data.meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.
data.sentence: The word حِسَابٍ comes from the root ح س ب and is associated with the meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.

data.meanings: to protect, save, preserve, ward off, guard against evil and calamity, be secure, take as a shield, regard the duty. muttaqii - one who guard against evil and against that which harms and injures and is regardful of his duty towards human beings and God.
data.sentence: The word اتَّقُوا comes from the root و ق ي and is associated with the meanings: to protect, save, preserve, ward off, guard against evil and calamity, be secure, take as a shield, regard the duty. muttaqii - one who guard against evil and against that which harms and injures and is regardful of his duty towards human beings and God.

data.meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.
data.sentence: The word حَسَنَةٌ comes from the root ح س ن and is associated with the meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.

data.meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.
data.sentence: The word أَحْسَنُوا comes from the root ح س ن and is associated with the meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبَّكُمْ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
The word أَجْرَهُمْ comes from the root ا ج ر and is associated with the meanings: recompense/compensation/reward, hire/pay/wage for service, profit

data.meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.
data.sentence: The word الصَّابِرُونَ comes from the root ص ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.

data.meanings: to be ample, take in, comprehend, embrace.
data.sentence: The word وَاسِعَةٌ comes from the root و س ع and is associated with the meanings: to be ample, take in, comprehend, embrace.

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
data.sentence: The word يَاعِبَادِ comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.

data.meanings: To rotate, bring forth herbs abundantly. Land abundant, fruitful, productive, luxuriant with herbage. Place for alighting or abiding. To tarry, await, expect, be patient. "Earth, as opposed to heaven: and the ground, as meaning the surface of the earth, on which we tread, and sit, and lie". Good land. Remain, fixed, tarry in expectation [on the ground]. Heavy, slow, sluggish, inclining, or propending to the ground. Submissive. A carpet, anything that is spread. A tremor, vertigo arising from a relaxed state. Wood-fretter, termite.
data.sentence: The word وَأَرْضُ comes from the root ا ر ض and is associated with the meanings: To rotate, bring forth herbs abundantly. Land abundant, fruitful, productive, luxuriant with herbage. Place for alighting or abiding. To tarry, await, expect, be patient. "Earth, as opposed to heaven: and the ground, as meaning the surface of the earth, on which we tread, and sit, and lie". Good land. Remain, fixed, tarry in expectation [on the ground]. Heavy, slow, sluggish, inclining, or propending to the ground. Submissive. A carpet, anything that is spread. A tremor, vertigo arising from a relaxed state. Wood-fretter, termite.

data.meanings: to reach the end, keep ones promise, fulfil ones engagement, pay a debt, perform a promise. tawaffa - to die. wafaat - death.
data.sentence: The word يُوَفَّى comes from the root و ف ي and is associated with the meanings: to reach the end, keep ones promise, fulfil ones engagement, pay a debt, perform a promise. tawaffa - to die. wafaat - death.
